page.title: 02GEOLOGY
page.content:
The study area forms a{folded and {faulted}continuation of the southern flank of the main Mendip anticline. Dulcote and Tor hills are{upthrust {west-east ridges of Carboniferous {Limestone}rising to about 90 metres and forming an attractive backdrop to the medieval cathedral city of Wells. Both hills were previously quarried, but the former quarries now have alternative uses.
Deep valleys (or desert wadis) developed between the limestone ridges during{Triassic}times becoming infilled with scree debris (the {Dolomitic Conglomerate,}which is a locally important building stone) and silts and clays{(Red Marls).
cont...
